name: gazer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who gazes (= looks for a long time) at something or at another person: From the peak of Vesuvius, gazers admire the Bay of Naples. The Northern Lights enthralled sky gazers last night. One gazer may look away under pressure or threat from the other. See also
stargazer
More examplesFewer examplesTo the faraway gazer, a bridge is a series of lines against a landscape.He came out of the hotel and pushed his way through the crowd of gazers.A cluster of gazers and passengers stood on the dock waiting for the ship to arrive.By about 18 months of age most children are able to follow the gaze of another person, and infer things about the gazer from it.
